title: CodeExecutable
description: Abstract base type for executable code nodes (e.g. `CodeChunk`).
$comment:
Adds properties to the base `Executable` node type that are necessary for executable code.
The added properties are the same as for static code nodes. Both `code` and `programmingLanguage` are required.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

executionAuto.description: Under which circumstances the code should be automatically executed.

compilationDigest.description: A digest of the content, semantics and dependencies of the node.

executionDigest.description: The `compileDigest` of the node when it was last executed.

executionDependencies.description: The upstream dependencies of this node.

executionDependants.description: The downstream dependants of this node.

executionTags.description: Tags in the code which affect its execution

executionCount.description: A count of the number of times that the node has been executed.
executionCount.$comment:
Intended to increment with each successive execution of the node, including across sessions.
Note that this differs to the `execution_count` in Jupyter Notebook format which is
the "code cell's prompt number" and which resets at the start of each new session.

executionRequired.description: Whether, and why, the code requires execution or re-execution.

executionKernel.description: The id of the kernel that the node was last executed in.

executionStatus.description: Status of the most recent, including any current, execution.

executionEnded.description: The timestamp when the last execution ended.

errors.description: Errors when compiling (e.g. syntax errors) or executing the node.

programmingLanguage.description: The programming language of the code.

guessLanguage.description: Whether the programming language of the code should be guessed based on syntax and variables used

mediaType.description: Media type, typically expressed using a MIME format, of the code.
mediaType.$comment:
This property allows the differentiation of formats using the same programming language
or variants of a programming language. An example is using `programmingLanguage` "json" and
`encodingFormat` "application/ld+json" for JSON-LD code examples.
